text: Great <@U7V9DQ31P>, it works. All `macros`, `if`, `elif`, and `for` instructions written like this `{%- if stuff -%}`, `{%- endif -%}` delete all blank rows and spaces. I just had to put the last statement (`{{my_variable}}`) on the same line of the last instruction (`{% set my_variable = stuff %}`) to prevent line break in the returned value. The last line is so: `{% set my_variable = stuff %}{{my_variable}}`. Thank you Stefen. It does the job. <@UHGJ1MN14> you can use it if you want, it works like a charm.
<@U2H3TT8F2> Since Stefen resolved my question, do you still want the link?

thank you very much. It's obviously possible to intercept the property via API, manipulate it and then rewrite it in other properties. By the way, it's just not proportionate to create an integration (server/oauth/webhooks/etc.) to solve an easy problem like this one.
Probably we will create a lambda function to address this particular issue, but we can't do it this way everytime, because of the unjustified growth of "useless" properties in CRM
Nope, that was what I was going to suggest but I was curious to see how it was setup as well. Thanks <@U7V9DQ31P>! Ill make sure to add this into our documentation. (cc <@U7SL518D6>)

If I am building a custom html/hubl blog listing and post template how do I connect it to one of the blog posts so that it actually renders blog posts? If you use the drag and drop editor and use the blog content module it will automatically assign the blog to "contents" in the content for loop. How do we make this happen without using the blog content module?

Here’s how to do it in code:
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/blog-content-markup>
right - I looked at that. And my stupid ass has been building out pages all day and built this one out as a page and not a blog template which is why nothing was working hahaha Thanks Jon!
I’m a bit late for this but thanks!
